alert.note: Alert for Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 7:40PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting Prairie, White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Augusta affecting White and Woodruff Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Monroe and Arkansas Counties. White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Georgetown. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Farm fields and farm roads on either side of Highway 36 west of Georgetown inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet Wednesday morning, February 15, and remain steady near that level thereafter. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date White River Georgetown 21.0 21.2 Mon 7 PM 21.8 22.0 22.0 22.0 6 AM 2/15 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
